Body.Description: Type definition for a Datacenter
Body.Label: Datacenter
Body.Name: HypervisorDatacenterType

Body.Description: Type definition for a Cluster.
Body.Label: Cluster
Body.Name: HypervisorClusterType

Body.Description: Type definition for a Hypervisor Host.
Body.Label: ESXi Host
Body.Name: HypervisorHostType

Body.Description: Storage capacity.
Body.Label: Storage Capacity
Body.Name: StorageCapacityType

TypeDefinition.Description: Size must be a number (used in conjunction with unit).
TypeDefinition.Label: Size
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeSize

TypeDefinition.Description: Unit is a string with a single character unit symbol. Valid unit symbols are K, M, G, T, and P representing Bytes, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, Terabyte, and Petabyte respectively, where one Kilobyte equals 1024 Bytes, one Megabyte equals 1048576 Bytes and so on.
TypeDefinition.Label: Unit
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeUnit

Body.Description: NetApp storage target device.
Body.Label: NetApp Storage Target Datatype
Body.Name: NetAppStorageTargetDataType

TypeDefinition.Description: Storage target device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Device
TypeDefinition.Name: StorageDevice

Body.Description: NetApp storage virtual machine name.
Body.Label: NetApp Storage Virtual Machine
Body.Name: NetAppStorageVirtualMachineNameType

Body.Description: Choose an existing NetApp initiator group or create a new one.
Body.Label: NetApp Initiator Group Options
Body.Name: NetAppAddInitiatorGroupOptionsType

TypeDefinition.Description: If set to true, select an existing initiator group.
TypeDefinition.Label: Select Existing Initiator Group
TypeDefinition.Name: SelectExistingInitiatorGroup

TypeDefinition.Description: Existing initiator group.
TypeDefinition.Label: Existing Initiator Group
TypeDefinition.Name: ExistingIgroupName

TypeDefinition.Description: If set to true, create a new initiator group. Provide the initiator group name, operating system, protocol, and a list of initiators. Initiators can contain a FC WWPN such as "21:00:00:e0:8b:05:05:04" or an iSCSI initiator name such as "iqn.1998-01.com.example.iscsi:name1" or "eui.0123456789abcdef".
TypeDefinition.Label: Create New Initiator Group
TypeDefinition.Name: CreateNewInitiatorGroup

TypeDefinition.Description: The initiator group name must be alphanumeric, can include up to 96 characters, and may contain hyphen (-) or underscore (_).
TypeDefinition.Label: New Initiator Group Name
TypeDefinition.Name: NewIgroupName

TypeDefinition.Description: Initiator group protocol.
TypeDefinition.Label: Protocol
TypeDefinition.Name: Protocol

TypeDefinition.Description: Operating system for the initiator group.
TypeDefinition.Label: Operating System
TypeDefinition.Name: OperatingSystem

TypeDefinition.Description: List of initiators. The initiator can contain an FC WWPN such as "21:00:00:e0:8b:05:05:04" or an iSCSI initiator name such as "iqn.1998-01.com.example.iscsi:name1" or "eui.0123456789abcdef".
TypeDefinition.Label: Initiator
TypeDefinition.Name: Initiators

Body.Description: Choose an existing NetApp initiator group or create a new one.
Body.Label: NetApp Initiator Group Options
Body.Name: NetAppNewOrExistingInitiatorGroupType

TypeDefinition.Description: Select existing initiator group.
TypeDefinition.Label: Initiator Group
TypeDefinition.Name: ExistingIgroupName

TypeDefinition.Description: If selected, create a new initiator group by providing the initiator group name, operating system, protocol, and a list of initiators. Initiators can contain a FC WWPN such as "21:00:00:e0:8b:05:05:04" or an iSCSI initiator name such as "iqn.1998-01.com.example.iscsi:name1" or "eui.0123456789abcdef".
TypeDefinition.Label: New Initiator Group
TypeDefinition.Name: CreateNewInitiatorGroup

TypeDefinition.Description: The initiator group name must be alphanumeric, can include up to 96 characters, and may contain hyphen (-) or underscore (_).
TypeDefinition.Label: New Initiator Group Name
TypeDefinition.Name: NewIgroupName

TypeDefinition.Description: Initiator group protocol.
TypeDefinition.Label: Protocol
TypeDefinition.Name: Protocol

TypeDefinition.Description: Operating system for the initiator group.
TypeDefinition.Label: Operating System
TypeDefinition.Name: OperatingSystem

TypeDefinition.Description: List of initiators. The initiator can contain an FC WWPN such as "21:00:00:e0:8b:05:05:04" or an iSCSI initiator name such as "iqn.1998-01.com.example.iscsi:name1" or "eui.0123456789abcdef".
TypeDefinition.Label: Initiator
TypeDefinition.Name: Initiators

Body.Description: NetApp LUN path.
Body.Label: NetApp LUN Path
Body.Name: NetAppLunPathType

TypeDefinition.Description: LUN Path should be between 1 and 254 characters long depending on the device target selected it may vary, for example /vol/vol1/lun1.
TypeDefinition.Label: LUN Path
TypeDefinition.Name: LunPath

Body.Description: NetApp volume name.
Body.Label: NetApp Volume
Body.Name: NetAppVolumeNameType

Body.Description: Remove a LUN with LUN path and a storage virtual machine name as the inputs. On successful execution, the LUN path is generated as output.
Body.Label: Remove NetApp Smart LUN
Body.Name: RemoveNetAppSmartLun

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: LUN path (e.g., /vol/vol1/lun1).
InputDefinition.Label: LUN Path
InputDefinition.Name: LunPath

InputDefinition.Description: Remove the LUN even if the LUN is mapped to an initiator group.
InputDefinition.Label: Remove Mapped LUN
InputDefinition.Name: RemoveMappedLunFlag

InputDefinition.Description: Remove the volume when the LUN being removed is the last LUN on the volume.
InputDefinition.Label: Remove Volume
InputDefinition.Name: RemoveVolumeFlag

OutputDefinition.Description: LUN path (e.g., /vol/vol1/lun1).
OutputDefinition.Label: LUN Path
OutputDefinition.Name: LunPath

OutputDefinition.Description: Initiator Group Name
OutputDefinition.Label: Initiator Group Name
OutputDefinition.Name: IgroupName

Body.Description: Create a LUN and its volume, select an existing initiator group or create a new one, and map the LUN to the initiator group. Inputs are the storage virtual machine name, LUN name, LUN size, performance service level, LUN operating system format, and either a new or existing initiator group. On successful execution, LUN path, NAA ID, LUN capacity, volume name, initiator group name, and logical unit number are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: New NetApp Smart LUN
Body.Name: NewNetAppSmartLun

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: LUN name must be between 1 and 254 characters long. It should begin with a letter and only "a" to "z", "A" to "Z", "0" to "9", underscore (_) are allowed. The volume created for the LUN will be named the same as the LUN name and the LUN path will be at /vol/lun_name/lun_name.
InputDefinition.Label: LUN Name
InputDefinition.Name: LunName

InputDefinition.Description: LUN size and unit.
InputDefinition.Label: LUN Capacity
InputDefinition.Name: LunCapacity

InputDefinition.Description: Performance service levels represent the performance expectations of the clients or applications using the storage system. The selection of a performance service level indicates the location of the new storage in the cluster and the QoS policy assigned to the storage. Value is used for applications for which throughput and capacity are more important than latency. Performance is used for applications with modest performance needs and latency. Extreme is used for applications that expect the lowest latency and highest performance.
InputDefinition.Label: Performance Service Level
InputDefinition.Name: PerformanceServiceLevel

InputDefinition.Description: Operating system type for the new LUN.
InputDefinition.Label: LUN Operating System Format
InputDefinition.Name: LunOperatingSystemFormat

InputDefinition.Description: Choose an existing initiator group or create a new one.
InputDefinition.Label: Initiator Group Options
InputDefinition.Name: InitiatorGroupOptions

InputDefinition.Description: Enable local snapshot copies using the default policy.
InputDefinition.Label: Enable Local Snapshot Copies
InputDefinition.Name: LocalSnapshotCopies

OutputDefinition.Description: LUN path (e.g., /vol/vol1/lun1).
OutputDefinition.Label: LUN Path
OutputDefinition.Name: LunPath

OutputDefinition.Description: Network Address Authority identifier for the LUN.
OutputDefinition.Label: NAA ID
OutputDefinition.Name: NaaId

OutputDefinition.Description: LUN size and unit.
OutputDefinition.Label: LUN Capacity
OutputDefinition.Name: LunCapacity

OutputDefinition.Description: Initiator Group Name
OutputDefinition.Label: Initiator Group Name
OutputDefinition.Name: IgroupName

OutputDefinition.Description: Logical Unit Number
OutputDefinition.Label: Logical Unit Number
OutputDefinition.Name: LUN

OutputDefinition.Description: Remove the LUN even if the LUN is mapped to an initiator group when executing a Rollback.
OutputDefinition.Label: Remove Mapped LUN on Rollback
OutputDefinition.Name: RemoveMappedLunFlag

OutputDefinition.Description: Remove the volume with the LUN when executing a Rollback.
OutputDefinition.Label: Remove Volume on Rollback
OutputDefinition.Name: RemoveVolumeFlag

Body.Description: Type and version of datastore.
Body.Label: Types of Datastore
Body.Name: HypervisorDatastoreVersionsType

TypeDefinition.Description: Type and version of datastore
TypeDefinition.Label: Type of Datastore
TypeDefinition.Name: VMFSVersion

TypeDefinition.Description: Canonical disk (also called NaaId) that backs the datastore (example: 6cc167e972c4928023401a54db995b66).
TypeDefinition.Label: Disk
TypeDefinition.Name: Disk

TypeDefinition.Description: The remote path of the NFS mount point.
TypeDefinition.Label: Remote Path
TypeDefinition.Name: RemotePath

TypeDefinition.Description: The hostnames or IP addresses of remote NFS server. In case of NFS v4.1 this may have multiple entries.
TypeDefinition.Label: NFS Server Address
TypeDefinition.Name: RemoteHostNames

TypeDefinition.Description: Access mode for the NFS server. Select read-only if volume is exported as read-only.
TypeDefinition.Label: Access Mode
TypeDefinition.Name: AccessMode

TypeDefinition.Description: Security for the NFS datastore. Default is the basic AUTH_SYS security.
TypeDefinition.Label: Security type
TypeDefinition.Name: SecurityType

Body.Description: Type definition for a Datastore.
Body.Label: Datastore
Body.Name: HypervisorDatastoreType

Body.Description: Remove datastore from selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), datastore as inputs. On successful execution, the datastore name, NaaId of the deleted datastore, and the LUN number are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: Remove Hypervisor Datastore
Body.Name: RemoveHypervisorDatastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore is hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore is hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the datastore to be removed.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Name of the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore
OutputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Disk associated with the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: Disk name
OutputDefinition.Name: NAAId

OutputDefinition.Description: LUN number of the datastore that was removed.
OutputDefinition.Label: LUN Number
OutputDefinition.Name: LUNNumber

Body.Description: Create a new datastore on selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), and datastore. For VMFS, the canonical disk name, and VMFS version inputs are needed. For NFS, remote server and mount path, and NFS version are needed. On successful execution, the datastore name, disk name, VMFS version, and datacenter name are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: New Hypervisor Datastore
Body.Name: NewHypervisorDatastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name for the new datastore, limited to 42 characters.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description: Type and version of the new datastore. Minimum datastore size: VMFS 5 - 1.3GB, VMFS 6 - 2GB. Kerberos support is enabled in NFS4.1 only.
InputDefinition.Label: Type of Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: DatastoreVersion

OutputDefinition.Description: Name of the newly created datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore
OutputDefinition.Name: Datastore

OutputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
OutputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

OutputDefinition.Description: Type of the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: VMFS Version
OutputDefinition.Name: VMFSVersion

OutputDefinition.Description: Type of the new datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Datastore Type
OutputDefinition.Name: DatastoreType

OutputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
OutputDefinition.Label: Cluster
OutputDefinition.Name: Cluster

OutputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
OutputDefinition.Label: Host
OutputDefinition.Name: Host

OutputDefinition.Description: Disk identity of the newly created datastore.
OutputDefinition.Label: Disk
OutputDefinition.Name: Disk

Body.Description: Create a new VMFS datastore. A volume and LUN with the same name as the datastore are created using the New NetApp Smart LUN task.

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter associated with the new datastore.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster on which the datastore will be hosted.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the datastore will be hosted. If cluster is specified, then host will be ignored.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Name for the new datastore, limited to 42 characters. It should begin with a letter and only "a" to "z", "A" to "Z", "0" to "9", underscore (_) are allowed. The volume and LUN created will be named the same as the datastore name and the LUN path will be at /vol/datastore_name/datastore_name.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore Name
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description: Datastore/volume/LUN size and unit.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore Capacity
InputDefinition.Name: LunCapacity

InputDefinition.Description: Storage virtual machine name.
InputDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

InputDefinition.Description: Performance service levels represent the performance expectations of the clients or applications using the storage system. The selection of a performance service level indicates the location of the new storage in the storage device and the QoS policy assigned to the storage. Value is used for applications for which throughput and capacity are more important than latency. Performance is used for applications with modest performance needs and latency. Extreme is used for applications that expect the lowest latency and highest performance. Note: If the selected performance service level is not valid for the storage platform, the task will fail with an error message. Use the None option if the storage virtual machine already has a QoS policy group.
InputDefinition.Label: Performance Service Level
InputDefinition.Name: PerformanceServiceLevel

InputDefinition.Description: Operating system type for the new LUN.
InputDefinition.Label: LUN Operating System Format
InputDefinition.Name: LunOperatingSystemFormat

InputDefinition.Description: Choose an existing initiator group or create a new one.
InputDefinition.Label: Initiator Group Options
InputDefinition.Name: InitiatorGroupOptions

InputDefinition.Description: Enable local snapshot copies using the default policy.
InputDefinition.Label: Enable Local Snapshot Copies
InputDefinition.Name: LocalSnapshotCopies

Body.Label: New VMFS Datastore Using NetApp Smart LUN
Body.Name: NewVMFSDatastoreUsingNetAppSmartLUN

Tasks.Description: Create a LUN and its volume, select an existing initiator group or create a new one, and map the LUN to the initiator group. Inputs are the storage virtual machine name, LUN name, LUN size, performance service level, LUN operating system format, and either a new or existing initiator group. On successful execution, LUN path, NAA ID, LUN capacity, volume name, initiator group name, and logical unit number are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: New NetApp Smart LUN
Tasks.Name: NewNetAppSmartLun1

Tasks.Description: Create a new datastore on selected hypervisor. Requires datacenter, cluster (or host), and datastore. For VMFS, the canonical disk name, and VMFS version inputs are needed. For NFS, remote server and mount path, and NFS version are needed. On successful execution, the datastore name, disk name, VMFS version, and datacenter name are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: New Hypervisor Datastore
Tasks.Name: NewHypervisorDatastore1

Body.Description: Remove a LUN.
Body.Name: RemoveNetAppSmartLun

Batch.Body: {"name": "{{.global.task.input.LunName}}", "smart_container": true, "svm": {"name": "{{.global.task.input.StorageVirtualMachineName}}"},  "san": { "protection_type": { "local_policy": {{if .global.task.input.LocalSnapshotCopies }} "default" {{else}} "none" {{end}} }, "os_type": "{{.global.task.input.LunOperatingSystemFormat}}", "application_components":[{ "name": "{{.global.task.input.LunName}}", "total_size": "{{.global.task.input.LunCapacity.VolumeSize}}{{.global.task.input.LunCapacity.VolumeUnit}}", "lun_count": "1", {{if index .global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions "ExistingIgroupName"}} "igroup_name": "{{.global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.ExistingIgroupName}}", {{else if index .global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions "NewIgroupName"}} "igroup_name": "{{.global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.NewIgroupName}}", {{end}} {{if eq .global.task.input.PerformanceServiceLevel "none"}} "qos": {"policy": {"name": "none"}} {{else}} "storage_service": {"name": "{{.global.task.input.PerformanceServiceLevel}}"} {{end}} }] {{if and (index .global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions "NewIgroupName") (not (index .global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions "ExistingIgroupName")) }}, "new_igroups":[{ "name": "{{.global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.NewIgroupName}}", {{$InitiatorList:= AsSlice .global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.Initiators}} "initiators": [{{range $index, $initiator:= $InitiatorList}} {{if $index}},{{end}}"{{$initiator}}" {{end}}], "protocol": "{{.global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.Protocol}}", "os_type": "{{.global.task.input.InitiatorGroupOptions.OperatingSystem}}"}] {{end}} }}
Batch.Name: NewCreateLun

Output.Datastore: {{if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS6"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS5"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS41"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS41.output.Datastore}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS.output.Datastore}}{{end}}
Output.DatastoreType: {{if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS6"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "VMFS5"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplVMFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS41"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS41.output.DatastoreType}}{{else if eq .global.task.input.DatastoreVersion.VMFSVersion "NFS"}}{{.global.NewHypervisorDatastoreVmwareImplNFS.output.DatastoreType}}{{end}}
